page.title: 08LONGMYND-THE NATIONAL TRUST
page.content: The{National Trust <NT>}is an organisation which{owns and looks {after countryside of natural beauty {and importance in England}.200 square miles of the Longmynd are owned by the NT.It is the area around Church Stretton. On the 5th of November, 1959, some members of the NT decided to buy the Longmynd, which was one of Britain's most beautiful country spots situated outside Church Stretton.It cost them Â£18,500 to buy. The public raised most of the money and in seven months the Longmynd was bought.The deeds were received on behalf of the NT by Mr.Cadbury,one of the members of the NT committee. They wanted to buy it so that no-one could build houses or dig mines or spoil the area.
